alert.note: Alert for Aransas Islands; Bee; Coastal Aransas; Coastal Kleberg; Coastal Nueces; Coastal Refugio; Coastal San Patricio; Duval; Inland Kleberg; Inland Nueces; Inland Refugio; Inland San Patricio; Jim Wells; Kleberg Islands; La Salle; Live Oak; McMullen; Nueces Islands; Webb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 01 at 2:13PM CST until March 03 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Thursday Afternoon through Friday Morning... .A strong cold front will move across South Texas Thursday late afternoon and evening. Strong northwest winds and low relative humidity values are expected behind the front. This will result in critical fire weather conditions across much of the area beginning late Thursday afternoon in the Rio Grande Plains and into the evening farther east. These conditions will persist through Thursday night and into Friday morning. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THURSDAY TO 9 AM CST FRIDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES FOR MOST OF SOUTH TEXAS... The National Weather Service in Corpus Christi has issued a Red Flag Warning for a combination of strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 3 PM Thursday to 9 AM CST Friday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...La Salle, McMullen, Live Oak, Bee, Webb, Duval, Jim Wells, Inland Kleberg, Inland Nueces, Inland San Patricio, Coastal Aransas, Inland Refugio, Coastal Kleberg, Coastal Nueces, Coastal San Patricio, Aransas Islands, Coastal Refugio, Kleberg Islands and Nueces Islands. * TIMING...Thursday Afternoon through Friday Morning. * WINDS...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 13 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the upper 70s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Residents are urged to exercise care with respect to all outdoor activities that could inadvertently cause wildfires. Report wildfires quickly to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
